title: PMD forecast dry weather for most parts of country
content:
ISLAMABAD, Sep 25 (APP):Pakistan Meterological Department (PMD) has forecast dry weather for most parts of the country during the next 24 hours.
However, rain-wind/thundershower is expected in south Punjab and Gilgit-Baltistan during evening/night.
According to the synoptic situation, a shallow westerly wave was still prevailing over northern parts of the country.
During the last 24 hours, rain-wind/thundershower occurred in Punjab, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Gilgit Baltistan and Kashmir. Hot and dry weather prevailed in other parts of the country.
The rainfall recorded during the last 24 hours was Punjab: Murree, Okara 45mm, Rawalpindi (Kacheri 31, Chaklala 21, Shamsabad 13), Faisalabad 28, Attock 26, Noorpur Thal 16, Sargodha 12, Mangala 11, Joharabad 09, Islamabad (Bokra 23, Airport, Zero Point) 09, Saidpur 07, Golra 05), Chakwal 04, Hafizabad 02, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa: Balakot 40, Peshawar (Airport, City), Kakul, Bacha Khan (Airport) 18, Malam Jabba 15, Dir (Lower 06, Upper 02) ), Saidu Sharif 06, Patan 05, Dera Ismail Khan, Charat 01, Kashmir: Garhi Dupatta 28, Kotli 15, Muzaffarabad (Airport, City) 11, Rawalakot 03, Gilgit-Baltistan: Gupis, Skardu, Bunji 04, Bagrote, Hunza, Astore and Babusar 02.
The highest maximum temperatures recorded were Sibbi 41 C, Lasbella, Shaheed Benazirabad and Pasni 40 C.
